Bob Anderson (racing driver).label: Bob Anderson
Bob Anderson (racing driver).description: Robert Hugh Fearon "Bob" Anderson was a Grand Prix motorcycle road racer and racing driver from England. He competed in Grand Prix motorcycle racing from 1958 to 1960 and in Formula One from 1963 to the 1967 seasons. Wikipedia

Mike Hailwood.label: Mike Hailwood
Mike Hailwood.description: Stanley Michael Bailey Hailwood, MBE, GM was a British Grand Prix motorcycle road racer regarded by many as one of the greatest racers of all time. Wikipedia

Ben Drinkwater.label: Ben Drinkwater
Ben Drinkwater.description: Reuben Thomas 'Ben' Drinkwater born in Rochdale, Lancashire, England a railway signalman and motor-cycle racer who competed in the Isle of Man TT Races and the Manx Grand Prix. Wikipedia
Ben Drinkwater.Died: June 9, 1949, Isle of Man, United Kingdom

Kelvin Tatum.label: Kelvin Tatum
Kelvin Tatum.description: Kelvin Martin Tatum MBE is a former British international motorcycle speedway and Grasstrack rider. Wikipedia

Michael Gibson (TV presenter).label: Michael Gibson
Michael Gibson (TV presenter).description: Michael Gibson is a TV presenter and documentary director. He presented the MTV Select television program which aired weekday afternoons on MTV across Europe. Wikipedia

Jorge Lorenzo.label: Jorge Lorenzo
Jorge Lorenzo.description: Jorge Lorenzo Guerrero is a Spanish professional motorcycle road racer. He is the 2006 and 2007 250cc World Champion, and the 2010 and 2012 MotoGP World Champion. He currently competes in the MotoGP class, riding for the factory Yamaha team. Wikipedia

Norifumi Abe.label: Norifumi Abe
Norifumi Abe.description: Norifumi "Norick" Abe, or Norick Abe was a Japanese motorcycle road racer who was previously a 500 cc/MotoGP rider. Wikipedia

Shunji Yatsushiro.label: Shunji Yatsushiro
Shunji Yatsushiro.description: Shunji Yatsushiro is a former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer from Japan. He began his Grand Prix career in 1986. He enjoyed his best season in 1987 when he finished the season in ninth place in the 500cc world championship. Wikipedia

Carlo Ubbiali.label: Carlo Ubbiali
Carlo Ubbiali.description: Carlo Ubbiali is an Italian nine-time World Champion motorcycle road racer. In the 1950s, he was a dominant force in the smaller classes of Grand Prix motorcycle racing. Wikipedia

Eddie Lawson.label: Eddie Lawson
Eddie Lawson.description: Eddie Lawson is a former four-time Grand Prix motorcycle racing World Champion. His penchant for not crashing and consistently finishing in the points earned him the nickname "Steady Eddie". Wikipedia

Freddie Frith.label: Freddie Frith
Freddie Frith.description: Frederick Lee "Freddie" Frith OBE was a British former Grand Prix motorcycle road racing world champion. A former stonemason and motor-trader dealer was a stylish rider and five times winner of the Isle of Man TT. Wikipedia

Jim Redman.label: Jim Redman
Jim Redman.description:
James Albert Redman MBE is a six-time World Champion motorcycle road racer.
As a young man, he emigrated to Rhodesia in 1952, where he began his racing career. He met with John Love who was changing from motorcycle racing to single-seat cars. Wikipedia

Joey Dunlop.label: Joey Dunlop
Joey Dunlop.description: William Joseph Dunlop, OBE, was a world champion motorcyclist from Ballymoney in Northern Ireland. In 2005 he was voted the fifth greatest motorcycling icon ever by Motorcycle News. Wikipedia

Marco Melandri.label: Marco Melandri
Marco Melandri.description: Marco Melandri is an Italian motorcycle road racer currently racing for BMW Motorrad Motorsport World Superbike Team. Melandri is also a former 250cc World Champion in 2002. Wikipedia

Mattia Pasini.label: Mattia Pasini
Mattia Pasini.description: Mattia Pasini is an Italian Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. He participated in his first race at the age of 9. Wikipedia

Pentti Korhonen.label: Pentti Korhonen
Pentti Korhonen.description: Pentti Korhonen is a former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. He had his most successful year in 1975 when he won the 350cc Yugoslavian Grand Prix and finished in third place in the 350cc World ... Wikipedia

Toni Elías.label: Toni Elías
Toni Elías.description: Antonio "Toni" Elías Justícia is a professional motorcycle racer and inaugural champion of the Moto2 World Championship. He is the third member of the Elías family to compete in motorcycle racing. He has a single MotoGP victory. Wikipedia

Ben Spies.label: Ben Spies
Ben Spies.description: Ben Spies, also known as "Elbowz" due to his riding style where his elbows protrude outward, is a former professional motorcycle road racer who turned pro in 2000. Wikipedia

Dirk Raudies.label: Dirk Raudies
Dirk Raudies.description:
Dirk Raudies is a former German Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. His greatest success on the racetrack was winning the 125cc Grand Prix world championship in 1993 on a Honda RS125R.
Since 2004, Raudies has been a commentator at Eurosport. Wikipedia
Dirk Raudies.Born: June 17, 1964 (age 49), Biberach an der Riss, Germany

John Kocinski.label: John Kocinski
John Kocinski.description: John Kocinski is a retired Grand Prix motorcycle road racer whose successes include winning the 1990 250cc World Championship, and the 1997 Superbike World Championship title. Wikipedia
John Kocinski.Born: March 20, 1968 (age 46), Little Rock, Arkansas, United States

Marc Márquez.label: Marc Márquez
Marc Márquez.description: Marc Márquez i Alentà is a Spanish Grand Prix motorcycle road racer and current MotoGP world champion. Wikipedia

Niklas Ajo.label: Niklas Ajo
Niklas Ajo.description: Niklas Ajo is a Finnish Grand Prix motorcycle racer, and the 2009 champion of the Finnish 125GP Championship. Ajo has also competed in the Red Bull MotoGP Rookies Cup and the Spanish 125GP Championship. Wikipedia

Alexander Lundh.label: Alexander Lundh
Alexander Lundh.description: Alexander Lundh is a Grand Prix motorcycle racer from Sweden. He competes in the Superbike World Championship for Team Pedercini, riding a Kawasaki. Wikipedia

Esteve Rabat.label: Esteve Rabat
Esteve Rabat.description: Esteve "Tito" Rabat Bergada is a Spanish motorcycle racer who currently competes in the Moto2 class in the Motorcycle World championship. He started racing professionally in 2005, and made his Grand Prix début at that season's Valencian Grand Prix. Wikipedia

Joan Lascorz.label: Joan Lascorz
Joan Lascorz.description: Joan Lascorz Moreno is a former Spanish motorcycle racer. After success in domestic championships on both tarmac and gravel, he competed in the Supersport World Championship in 2007 and 2008. Wikipedia

Kris McLaren.label: Kris McLaren
Kris McLaren.description: Kris McLaren is an Australian Grand Prix motorcycle racer. Wikipedia

Les Collins.label: Les Collins
Les Collins.description: Leslie 'Les' Collins is a former speedway rider. He finished runner-up in the 1982 Speedway World Championship as well as winning the Intercontinental Final in 1982, the British Under-21 Championship ... Wikipedia

Paul Thorp.label: Paul Thorp
Paul Thorp.description: Paul Thorp is a motorcycle speedway rider won the World Team Cup with England in 1989. Wikipedia

Simon Nielsen (speedway rider).label: Simon Nielsen
Simon Nielsen (speedway rider).description:
Simon Nielsen is a Danish motorcycle speedway rider who rode in the Denmark U-19 national team.
Nielsen won 2005 Individual Speedway FIM Youth Gold Trophy 80 cc, unofficial U-16 World Championship. Wikipedia

Stan Williams (speedway rider).label: Stan Williams
Stan Williams (speedway rider).description:
Stan Williams was a British motorcycle speedway rider for Sheffield and Coventry.
Born in Leicester, Williams started grasstrack racing at the age of seventeen, pushing his bike the eighteen miles from ... Wikipedia

Frédéric Protat.label: Frédéric Protat
Frédéric Protat.description:
Frédéric Protat is a retired French motorcycle racing driver.
In 1991, he was the French superbike Champion in the 250 cc category.
His friend with the same first name, Frédéric Provost was helping him during his motorcycle lessons at the beginning. Wikipedia

Kalle Katajisto.label: Kalle Katajisto
Kalle Katajisto.description: Kalle Katajisto is a Finnish motorcycle speedway rider who is a member of the Finnish national team. He rode in the UK for the Edinburgh Monarchs. Wikipedia

Kim Nilsson.label: Kim Nilsson
Kim Nilsson.description: Kim Nilsson is a Swedish motorcycle speedway rider who won bronze medal in the 2008 Team U-21 World Championship. Wikipedia

Glyn Taylor.label: Glyn Taylor
Glyn Taylor.description: Glyn Clifford Taylor is an Australian former motorcycle speedway rider, who went on to a career building and curating speedway tracks, tuning engines, and in speedway promotion and team management. Wikipedia

Arthur Wheeler (motorcyclist).label: Arthur Wheeler
Arthur Wheeler (motorcyclist).description: Arthur Frederick Wheeler was a Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. Wheeler gained a reputation as one of the top privateer racers on the Grand Prix circuit. Wikipedia

Jordan Frampton.label: Jordan Frampton
Jordan Frampton.description: Jordan Frampton was a motorcycle speedway rider from Great Britain. Wikipedia

Emil Sayfutdinov.label: Emil Sayfutdinov
Emil Sayfutdinov.description: Emil Damirovich Sayfutdinov is a Russian motorcycle speedway rider and member of the Russian national teams. He won the 2007 and 2008 Under-21 World Championship. He is a permanent rider of the 2010 Speedway Grand Prix. Wikipedia

Max Neukirchner.label: Max Neukirchner
Max Neukirchner.description: Max Neukirchner is a professional motorcycle racer currently competing in the IDM Superbike Championship aboard a Ducati 1199 Panigale. Wikipedia

Sébastien Charpentier (motorcycle racer).label: Sébastien Charpentier
Sébastien Charpentier (motorcycle racer).description:
Sébastien Charpentier is a French motorcycle road racer. He is the only man to have won the Supersport World Championship in successive years, 2005 and 2006.
He made his debut in 1996, when he won the France Honda CB500 Cup. Wikipedia

Brian Crutcher.label: Brian Crutcher
Brian Crutcher.description: Brian Crutcher is a former international speedway rider who finished second at the 1954 Speedway World Championship finals. Wikipedia

Yukio Kagayama.label: Yukio Kagayama
Yukio Kagayama.description: Yukio Kagayama is a professional motorcycle road racer. He began motorcycle racing in 1990, spending many years in the All Japan Road Race Championship, finishing fourth in 2001. Wikipedia

Barry Sheene.label: Barry Sheene
Barry Sheene.description: Barry Steven Frank Sheene MBE was a British World Champion Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. After a racing career stretching from 1968 to 1984 he retired from competition and relocated to Australia, ... Wikipedia
Nominations: BBC Sports Personality of the Year Award

Boet van Dulmen.label: Boet van Dulmen
Boet van Dulmen.description: Boet van Dulmen is a former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. Together with Wil Hartog and Jack Middelburg, he was part of a contingent of Dutch riders who competed at the highest levels of Grand Prix racing in the late 1970s. Wikipedia

Jack Middelburg.label: Jack Middelburg
Jack Middelburg.description: Jack Middelburg was a former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. Together with Wil Hartog and Boet van Dulmen, he was part of a contingent of Dutch riders who competed at the highest levels of Grand Prix racing in the late 1970s. Wikipedia

Jan Huberts.label: Jan Huberts
Jan Huberts.description: Jan Huberts is a former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer from the Netherlands. He had his best year in 1962 when he won two Grand Prix races and finished the season in third place behind Ernst Degner and Hans-Georg Anscheidt. Wikipedia

John Hopkins (motorcycle racer).label: John Hopkins
John Hopkins (motorcycle racer).description: John "Hopper" Hopkins is an American motorcycle racer currently racing in the British Superbike Championship. Hopkins has raced previously in MotoGP, AMA Superbike Championship, and Superbike World Championship. Wikipedia

Paul Lodewijkx.label: Paul Lodewijkx
Paul Lodewijkx.description: Paul Lodewijkx was a Grand Prix motorcycle road racer from the Netherlands. He had his best year in 1968 when he won the Dutch TT, and finished the season in second place behind Hans-Georg Anscheidt. Wikipedia

Wil Hartog.label: Wil Hartog
Wil Hartog.description: Wil Hartog is a former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. In 1977, Hartog became the first Dutchman to win a 500cc Grand Prix when he claimed a victory at the Dutch TT. Wikipedia

Michael Rutter (motorcycle racer).label: Michael Rutter
Michael Rutter (motorcycle racer).description: Michael Karl Rutter nicknamed "The Blade", is a British motorcycle racer. He has a reputation for being at his best in wet conditions and his favourite circuit is Oulton Park. Wikipedia

Randy de Puniet.label: Randy de Puniet
Randy de Puniet.description: Randy de Puniet is a French Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. He is currently racing for the Power Electronics Aspar team in MotoGP, having raced in this class regularly since 2006. Wikipedia

Inge Stoll.label: Inge Stoll
Inge Stoll.description:
Ingeborg Stoll-Laforge was a female German motorcycle racer.
Inge Stoll competed as a female passenger with sidecar driver Jacques Drion and won the 1952 and 1954 French Sidecar Championship. Wikipedia

Julián Miralles.label: Julián Miralles
Julián Miralles.description: Julián Miralles is a former Grand Prix motorcycle racer from Spain. His son, Julián Miralles Rodríguez, is also a motorcycle racer. Wikipedia

Ron Haslam.label: Ron Haslam
Ron Haslam.description: Ronald Haslam is a British former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer who has been racing for over thirty years, winning three World titles, four British championships and having ridden in almost 110 GPs. Wikipedia

Stefan Dörflinger.label: Stefan Dörflinger
Stefan Dörflinger.description:
Stefan Dörflinger is a Swiss former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer.
Dörflinger won four consecutive FIM road racing world championships. In 1982 and 1983, he was the 50 cc world champion. Wikipedia

Alex Hofmann.label: Alex Hofmann
Alex Hofmann.description: Alexander Hofmann is a retired Grand Prix motorcycle racer, who now works on German television coverage of the sport. He is nicknamed 'The Hoff' in English-speaking countries, a nod to David Hasselhoff. Wikipedia

Salvador Cañellas.label: Salvador Cañellas
Salvador Cañellas.description: Salvador Cañellas is a former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer and rally car racer from Spain. He had his best year in 1970 when he finished fourth in the 50cc world championship. Wikipedia

Jack Findlay.label: Jack Findlay
Jack Findlay.description: Cyril John Findlay was an Australian former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. He is noted for having one of the longest racing careers in Grand Prix history spanning 20 years. Wikipedia

Paddy Driver.label: Paddy Driver
Paddy Driver.description:
Paddy Driver is a former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer and a racing driver from South Africa.
He competed on the Grand Prix motorcycle racing circuit from 1959 to 1965. Wikipedia

Ernesto Brambilla.label: Ernesto Brambilla
Ernesto Brambilla.description: Ernesto 'Tino' Brambilla is a former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer and a professional race car driver from Italy. Born in Monza, he was the brother of driver Vittorio Brambilla. Wikipedia

Alessandro Andreozzi.label: Alessandro Andreozzi
Alessandro Andreozzi.description: Alessandro Andreozzi is a former Grand Prix motorcycle racer from Italy. He currently races for Pedercini Team in the Superbike World Championship aboard a Kawasaki ZX-10R. Wikipedia

Alessandro Brannetti.label: Alessandro Brannetti
Alessandro Brannetti.description: Alessandro Brannetti is a Grand Prix motorcycle racer from Italy. Wikipedia

Kenny Roberts, Jr..label: Kenny Roberts, Jr.
Kenny Roberts, Jr..description: Kenneth Leroy Roberts Junior is a former American motorcycle road racer who won the 500cc Road Racing World Championship in 2000. He joins his father Kenny Roberts, as the only father - son duo to have won 500cc World Championships. Wikipedia
Kenny Roberts, Jr..Born: July 25, 1973 (age 40), Mountain View, California, United States

Conor Cummins.label: Conor Cummins
Conor Cummins.description: Conor Cummins is a British motorcycle road racer. Conor rides extensively on the British Road Racing Circuit competing in the British Superstock Championship as well as his home event the Isle of Man TT. Wikipedia

Eric Oliver.label: Eric Oliver
Eric Oliver.description: Eric Staines Oliver was an English motorcycle racer best remembered as four time FIM Sidecar World Champion, riding a Norton. His passenger in 1949 was Denis Jenkinson. Wikipedia

Alfredo Milani.label: Alfredo Milani
Alfredo Milani.description: Alfredo Milani was an Italian Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. His best year was in 1951 when he won two Grand Prix races and finished second to Geoff Duke in the 500cc world championship. Milani rode for the Gilera factory for his entire career. Wikipedia

Phil Vance.label: Phil Vance
Phil Vance.description:
Philip Howard "Phil" Vance is a British former motorcycle speedway rider.
Born in Cardiff, Vance was signed by King's Lynn Stars in the late 1970s, riding in their successful Anglia Junior League team ... Wikipedia

Andrew Lawson (motorcycle racer).label: Andrew Lawson
Andrew Lawson (motorcycle racer).description: Andrew Lawson is a Grand Prix motorcycle racer from Australia. Wikipedia

Zoltán Adorján.label: Zoltán Adorján
Zoltán Adorján.description: Zoltán Adorján is former international motorcycle speedway rider who appeared in two Speedway World Championship finals and finished third in the World Pairs Championship in 1990. Wikipedia

Kevin Magee (motorcycle racer).label: Kevin Magee
Kevin Magee (motorcycle racer).description: Kevin Magee is an Australian former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer who raced in 36 grands prix during his career, winning the 1988 Spanish Grand Prix. He is currently a television commentator for Fox Sports Australia. Wikipedia

Joe Owen.label: Joe Owen
Joe Owen.description:
Joseph William "Joe" Owen is a British former motorcycle speedway rider.
Born in Ormskirk, Owen took up speedway at the age of fourteen at the training school at Belle Vue and made his competitive debut ... Wikipedia

Cameron Donald.label: Cameron Donald
Cameron Donald.description: Cameron Donald is a professional motorcycle racer who has raced at the Macau Grand Prix, the North West 200 and the Isle of Man TT Races. He lives in Warrandyte, Victoria in Australia. During the racing season Cameron lives in Northern Ireland. Wikipedia

Kouki Takahashi.label: Kouki Takahashi
Kouki Takahashi.description: Kouki Takahashi was a Grand Prix motorcycle racer from Japan, Yuki Takahashi's brother. Wikipedia

Manuel Tatasciore.label: Manuel Tatasciore
Manuel Tatasciore.description: Manuel Tatasciore is an Italian Grand Prix motorcycle racer. He races in the CIV Supersport 600 Championship for Ellan Vannin Motorsport aboard a MV Agusta. Wikipedia

Pierfrancesco Chili.label: Pierfrancesco Chili
Pierfrancesco Chili.description: Pierfrancesco 'Frankie' Chili, is a motorcycle racer who has raced in the Superbike World Championship and the 250cc and 500cc classes in Grand Prix. In World Superbike he had a record number of starts, as well as 10 poles and 17 wins. Wikipedia

Martin Glossop.label: Martin Glossop
Martin Glossop.description: Martin Glossop is a Grand Prix motorcycle racer from the United Kingdom. Wikipedia

Rafał Dobrucki.label: Rafał Dobrucki
Rafał Dobrucki.description: Rafał Dobrucki is a Polish speedway rider who was a permanent rider in 2000 Speedway Grand Prix. Wikipedia

Tommy Pettersson.label: Tommy Pettersson
Tommy Pettersson.description:
Thomas "Tommy" Pettersson is a Swedish former motorcycle speedway rider.
Born in Norrköping, Pettersson learnt to ride a speedway bike in England, at Olle Nygren's training school in Boston. Wikipedia

John Newbold.label: John Newbold
John Newbold.description: John Newbold was a former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. His best season was in 1976 when he finished in fifth place in the 500cc world championship riding a Suzuki motorcycle. Wikipedia

Bruno Spaggiari.label: Bruno Spaggiari
Bruno Spaggiari.description: Bruno Spaggiari is a former Italian Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. His best year was in 1960 when he finished fourth in the 125cc world championship. Wikipedia

Ila Teromaa.label: Ila Teromaa
Ila Teromaa.description: Ilkka "Ila" Teromaa is a Finnish former motorcycle speedway rider who rode in the British League for Leicester Lions and Cradley Heathens in the late 1970s and early 1980s. Wikipedia

Thomas H. Jonasson.label: Thomas H. Jonasson
Thomas H. Jonasson.description: Thomas Hjelm Jonasson is an international motorcycle speedway rider, who won the Premier League and the Premier Trophy with the Edinburgh Monarchs in 2008. Wikipedia

Jamie Hacking.label: Jamie Hacking
Jamie Hacking.description: Jamie Alexander Hacking, nicknamed The Hacker, is a professional motorcycle racer who has spent his entire career in the United States. He has chosen to sit out the 2010 due to limited options. Wikipedia

Herri Torrontegui.label: Herri Torrontegui
Herri Torrontegui.description: Herri Torrontegui, born April 19, 1967 in Gorliz, is a former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer from Spain. His best year was 1989, when he won two Grand Prix races and finished in fourth place in the 80cc world championship. Wikipedia

Graziano Rossi.label: Graziano Rossi
Graziano Rossi.description:
Graziano Rossi is an Italian former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. He is the father of 9 times motorcycle World Champion Valentino Rossi.
He began racing in the World Championship in 1977 riding a Suzuki in the 500cc class. Wikipedia

Franz Zorn.label: Franz Zorn
Franz Zorn.description: Franz Zorn is an Austrian ice speedway rider who was won Individual Ice Racing European Championship in 2008. Wikipedia

Cal Crutchlow.label: Cal Crutchlow
Cal Crutchlow.description: Cal Crutchlow is a professional motorcycle road racer. He is a former British Supersport champion and British Superbike race winner, and the 2009 Supersport World Champion. Wikipedia

Colin Edwards.label: Colin Edwards
Colin Edwards.description: Colin Edwards II nicknamed the Texas Tornado is an American professional motorcycle racer. He is a two-time World Superbike champion and has competed in MotoGP since 2003, now riding for the NGM Mobile Forward Racing team in the 2014 season. Wikipedia

William Lawson (speedway rider).label: William Lawson
William Lawson (speedway rider).description: William Lawson is former a Scottish speedway rider who rode with the Belle Vue Aces in the British Elite League. He ended his speedway career before the 2011 season. Wikipedia

Glen Richards.label: Glen Richards
Glen Richards.description: Glen Richards is an Australian superbike rider born in Adelaide but now lives in Hinckley, Leicestershire. He has won the British Supersport and Superstock championships, and has been a regular front-runner in the primary British Superbike class. Wikipedia

Jan de Vries (motorcyclist).label: Jan de Vries
Jan de Vries (motorcyclist).description: Jan de Vries is a former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. In 1971 he became the first Dutchman to win a F.I.M. world championship when he claimed the 50 cc title. In 1973 he won another 50 cc world championship. Wikipedia

Franco Uncini.label: Franco Uncini
Franco Uncini.description: Franco Uncini is an Italian former Grand Prix motorcycle road racing World Champion. Wikipedia

Libero Liberati.label: Libero Liberati
Libero Liberati.description:
Libero Liberati was an Italian motorcycle racer and the 1957 500cc Grand Prix World Champion.
Liberati was born in Terni. He became famous in his country, winning the Italian championship in 1948. Wikipedia

Maria Costello.label: Maria Costello
Maria Costello.description: Maria Costello MBE is a British motorcycle racer who held the Guinness World Record for being the fastest woman to lap the Isle of Man TT course at an average speed of 114.73 mph until Jenny Tinmouth took the record at the 2009 TT. Wikipedia

Mirko Giansanti.label: Mirko Giansanti
Mirko Giansanti.description: Mirko Giansanti is an Italian former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. His best year was in 1998 when he finished on the podium four times and finished in sixth place in the 125cc world championship. Wikipedia

Jarno Saarinen.label: Jarno Saarinen
Jarno Saarinen.description: Jarno Karl Keimo Saarinen was a Finnish Grand Prix motorcycle road racer. He is the only Finn to win a road racing world championship. Wikipedia
